reviewText: This a small nostalgic peek at how wonderful television could be and what superb writer Serling was! Live television was enthralling!

reviewText: I love Rod Serling's works, and can't get enough.  I only wish I could find more on DVD.  These are two wonderful plays written for TV.  If you like Serling, get this DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Joel, Holden "Barry Eysman MY REAL NAME"
reviewText: Rod Serling had his own private world of enigmas. Battlefields. Senate floor. Crises of conscience. Men at the top. No way to go back. Early Rod Serling and his words are literate and sharply honed. A perfect cast, direction, and small sets, seen, and upon a time, seen on, and perfect DVD quality make this disc cause for tribute. You forget the years. You even look at the advertising respectfully, because it's Rod's work you're seeing in between them. Rod was young then. He was not to get much older. A play about the senate. A play about war. Dialogue that goes to the bone. Close ups on faces of actors who were giants, forming words of Rod's. Not one mistake. Not one. These teleplays are as serious as they come. If you know Rod only from The Twilight Zone, and how brilliant that was, try his other works. Prepare again to meet the finest writer you ever have. He'll break your heart and your bones. And you'll be damn sorry you can't tell him thank you.Barry Eysman
Title: N/A

reviewText: Great dramas as Rod was a true writer and could bond with viewers on emotions, life experiences and allowing us to explore.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Two excellent dramas of the sort Rod Serling is well known for.  Stories like these are what made Serling the best Television writer of his generation and one of the best of all time.  Video quality is pretty decent for old kinescopes (the only way they had of recording live video shows at the time).  Includes the original Westinghouse live appliance commercials as well.  Each show clocks in at over 58 minutes, so about the only thing that could be missing from the original 60 minute broadcasts is a station bumper.
Title: N/A
